trans-unit.source: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about the controls and monitor performance on the Management Portal tabs for BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections. MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: Learn about the controls and monitor performance on the Management Portal tabs for BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections. MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: After you create your BizTalk Service and deploy your application, you can change some of the BizTalk Service settings and monitor the application performance.
trans-unit.target: After you create your BizTalk Service and deploy your application, you can change some of the BizTalk Service settings and monitor the application performance.

trans-unit.source: When you open the Azure Management Portal, you are automatically placed at the ALL ITEMS tab.
trans-unit.target: When you open the Azure Management Portal, you are automatically placed at the ALL ITEMS tab.

trans-unit.source: To view your BizTalk Service, select your BizTalk Service in the ALL ITEMS tab or select the BIZTALK SERVICES tab; and then select your BizTalk Service name.
trans-unit.target: To view your BizTalk Service, select your BizTalk Service in the ALL ITEMS tab or select the BIZTALK SERVICES tab; and then select your BizTalk Service name.

trans-unit.source: This opens a new window with the following tabs.
trans-unit.target: This opens a new window with the following tabs.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes these tabs.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes these tabs.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.

trans-unit.source: provides more information on the BizTalk Services Portal.
trans-unit.target: provides more information on the BizTalk Services Portal.

trans-unit.source: Connection Information
trans-unit.target: Connection Information

trans-unit.source: of the Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: of the Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: When you select Connection Information, then the Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer, and Default Key are displayed. You can copy these values.
trans-unit.target: When you select Connection Information, then the Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer, and Default Key are displayed. You can copy these values.

trans-unit.source: You can also open the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can also open the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Create an Access control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Create an Access control Namespace

trans-unit.source: provides more information on the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: provides more information on the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: in the Storage Account
trans-unit.target: in the Storage Account

trans-unit.source: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created. These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account. Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created. These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account. Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account. To do this:
trans-unit.target: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account. To do this:

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: . Select the Secondary Key. When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: . Select the Secondary Key. When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key. Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key. Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: . Now, select the Primary Key. This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.
trans-unit.target: . Now, select the Primary Key. This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: This process is called "rollover keys". The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: This process is called "rollover keys". The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: your application
trans-unit.target: your application

trans-unit.source: When you select Delete, your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.
trans-unit.target: When you select Delete, your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.

trans-unit.source: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Dashboard tab is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Dashboard tab is displayed.

trans-unit.source: In Dashboard, you can:
trans-unit.target: In Dashboard, you can:

trans-unit.source: Also displays the data usage in GB.
trans-unit.target: Also displays the data usage in GB.

trans-unit.source: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose the Relative or Absolute values and the time range Interval of the metrics that are displayed in the graph.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose the Relative or Absolute values and the time range Interval of the metrics that are displayed in the graph.

trans-unit.source: For a description of these performance metrics, go to <linkText>Available Metrics</linkText><title></title> in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For a description of these performance metrics, go to <linkText>Available Metrics</linkText><title></title> in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Update Tracking Database credentials
trans-unit.target: Update Tracking Database credentials

trans-unit.source: Changes the user name and password used to log into the Tracking Database.
trans-unit.target: Changes the user name and password used to log into the Tracking Database.

trans-unit.source: Update SSL Certificate
trans-unit.target: Update SSL Certificate

trans-unit.source: Can update the BizTalk Service to use a different SSL certificate. A self-signed SSL certificate is automatically created when you
trans-unit.target: Can update the BizTalk Service to use a different SSL certificate. A self-signed SSL certificate is automatically created when you

trans-unit.source: create the BizTalk Service
trans-unit.target: create the BizTalk Service

trans-unit.source: Download Certificate
trans-unit.target: Download Certificate

trans-unit.source: You can download the SSL certificate used by your BizTalk Service to a local machine.
trans-unit.target: You can download the SSL certificate used by your BizTalk Service to a local machine.

trans-unit.source: Status
trans-unit.target: Status

trans-unit.source: Displays the current status of your BizTalk Service. See
trans-unit.target: Displays the current status of your BizTalk Service. See

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Services: Service state chart
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Services: Service state chart

trans-unit.source: Service URL
trans-unit.target: Service URL

trans-unit.source: The URL for your BizTalk Service. This is the same as the
trans-unit.target: The URL for your BizTalk Service. This is the same as the

trans-unit.source: Domain URL
trans-unit.target: Domain URL

trans-unit.source: entered when your BizTalk Service is created.
trans-unit.target: entered when your BizTalk Service is created.

trans-unit.source: Public Virtual IP (VIP) Address
trans-unit.target: Public Virtual IP (VIP) Address

trans-unit.source: The IP address assigned to your BizTalk Service. It is used for all input endpoints and is the source address for outbound traffic. This IP address belongs to your BizTalk Service as long as it is created. If you delete the BizTalk Service, the IP address is assigned to another BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The IP address assigned to your BizTalk Service. It is used for all input endpoints and is the source address for outbound traffic. This IP address belongs to your BizTalk Service as long as it is created. If you delete the BizTalk Service, the IP address is assigned to another BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: ACS Namespace
trans-unit.target: ACS Namespace

trans-unit.source: Authenticates with the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Authenticates with the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Edition
trans-unit.target: Edition

trans-unit.source: Lists the Edition entered when the BizTalk Service is created.
trans-unit.target: Lists the Edition entered when the BizTalk Service is created.

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Displays the geographic region that hosts your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Displays the geographic region that hosts your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Created
trans-unit.target: Created

trans-unit.source: Displays the date and time the BizTalk Service was created.
trans-unit.target: Displays the date and time the BizTalk Service was created.

trans-unit.source: Tracking Database
trans-unit.target: Tracking Database

trans-unit.source: The Azure SQL Database name that stores the tracking tables used by your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SQL Database name that stores the tracking tables used by your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Requirements Explained
trans-unit.target: Requirements Explained

trans-unit.source: provides details on the Tracking Database.
trans-unit.target: provides details on the Tracking Database.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring/Archiving Storage
trans-unit.target: Monitoring/Archiving Storage

trans-unit.source: The Azure Storage account name that stores the monitoring output of your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Storage account name that stores the monitoring output of your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Requirements Explained
trans-unit.target: Requirements Explained

trans-unit.source: provides details on the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: provides details on the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Subscription Name
trans-unit.target: Subscription Name

trans-unit.source: Lists the subscription that hosts your BizTalk Service. The subscription governs access to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Lists the subscription that hosts your BizTalk Service. The subscription governs access to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Subscription ID
trans-unit.target: Subscription ID

trans-unit.source: When a subscription is created, a subscription ID is automatically generated. When using REST APIs, you may need to enter the Subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: When a subscription is created, a subscription ID is automatically generated. When using REST APIs, you may need to enter the Subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Connection Information

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: in the Storage Account
trans-unit.target: in the Storage Account

trans-unit.source: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created. These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account. Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created. These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account. Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account. To do this:
trans-unit.target: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account. To do this:

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: . Select the Secondary Key. When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: . Select the Secondary Key. When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key. Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key. Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys

trans-unit.source: . Now, select the Primary Key. This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.
trans-unit.target: . Now, select the Primary Key. This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: This process is called "rollover keys". The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: This process is called "rollover keys". The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: your application
trans-unit.target: your application

trans-unit.source: Your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.
trans-unit.target: Your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.

trans-unit.source: Does not apply to the Free Edition.
trans-unit.target: Does not apply to the Free Edition.

trans-unit.source: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Monitor tab is available and displays the following:
trans-unit.target: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Monitor tab is available and displays the following:

trans-unit.source: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: You choose which performance metrics are displayed.
trans-unit.target: You choose which performance metrics are displayed.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of six performance metrics can be displayed simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of six performance metrics can be displayed simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose the Relative or Absolute values and the time range Interval of the metrics that are displayed.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose the Relative or Absolute values and the time range Interval of the metrics that are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the Monitor tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the Monitor tab.

trans-unit.source: Select Add Metrics in the task bar: Select Add Metrics
trans-unit.target: Select Add Metrics in the task bar: Select Add Metrics

trans-unit.source: Check the performance metrics you want to display.
trans-unit.target: Check the performance metrics you want to display.

trans-unit.source: Select the checkmark to return to the Monitor tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkmark to return to the Monitor tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the circle next to the metric to display that metric's value in the graph.
trans-unit.target: Select the circle next to the metric to display that metric's value in the graph.

trans-unit.source: For example, the CPU Usage metric is grayed out; its output is not displayed in the graph: CPU Usage metric is grayed out
trans-unit.target: For example, the CPU Usage metric is grayed out; its output is not displayed in the graph: CPU Usage metric is grayed out

trans-unit.source: Select the grayed out circle to enable the CPU Usage metric to display its output in the graph: CPU Usage metric is enabled
trans-unit.target: Select the grayed out circle to enable the CPU Usage metric to display its output in the graph: CPU Usage metric is enabled

trans-unit.source: To remove a metric from the display graph and the list, select Delete Metric in the task bar.
trans-unit.target: To remove a metric from the display graph and the list, select Delete Metric in the task bar.

trans-unit.source: To add the metric back to the list, select Add Metrics in the task bar, check the metric, and select the checkmark to return to the Monitor tab.
trans-unit.target: To add the metric back to the list, select Add Metrics in the task bar, check the metric, and select the checkmark to return to the Monitor tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the grayed out circle to enable the metric.
trans-unit.target: Select the grayed out circle to enable the metric.

trans-unit.source: The following performance counters/metrics are available:
trans-unit.target: The following performance counters/metrics are available:

trans-unit.source: RountdTrip Latency
trans-unit.target: RountdTrip Latency

trans-unit.source: Displays the average time taken in milliseconds (ms) to process a message from the time the message is received until the message is fully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges. Only messages successfully processed are counted.
trans-unit.target: Displays the average time taken in milliseconds (ms) to process a message from the time the message is received until the message is fully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges. Only messages successfully processed are counted.

trans-unit.source: When the following events occur, a timestamp is created:
trans-unit.target: When the following events occur, a timestamp is created:

trans-unit.source: Message enters the gateway
trans-unit.target: Message enters the gateway

trans-unit.source: Message is routed to the destination
trans-unit.target: Message is routed to the destination

trans-unit.source: Destination response is received
trans-unit.target: Destination response is received

trans-unit.source: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway
trans-unit.target: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway

trans-unit.source: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:
trans-unit.target: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:

trans-unit.source: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway]
trans-unit.target: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway]

trans-unit.source: Failures At Source
trans-unit.target: Failures At Source

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages that failed by the BizTalk Service when pulling messages from the source endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages that failed by the BizTalk Service when pulling messages from the source endpoints.

trans-unit.source: CPU Usage
trans-unit.target: CPU Usage

trans-unit.source: Lists the average %Processor Time of all role instances.
trans-unit.target: Lists the average %Processor Time of all role instances.

trans-unit.source: Processing Latency
trans-unit.target: Processing Latency

trans-unit.source: Displays the average time taken In milliseconds (ms) to process a message by the BizTalk Service across all bridges, excluding the time spent in destinations. Only messages successfully processed are counted.
trans-unit.target: Displays the average time taken In milliseconds (ms) to process a message by the BizTalk Service across all bridges, excluding the time spent in destinations. Only messages successfully processed are counted.

trans-unit.source: When each of the following events occur, a timestamp is created:
trans-unit.target: When each of the following events occur, a timestamp is created:

trans-unit.source: Message enters the gateway
trans-unit.target: Message enters the gateway

trans-unit.source: Message is routed to the destination
trans-unit.target: Message is routed to the destination

trans-unit.source: Destination response is received
trans-unit.target: Destination response is received

trans-unit.source: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway
trans-unit.target: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway

trans-unit.source: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:
trans-unit.target: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:

trans-unit.source: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway] - [Destination response is received] + [Message is routed to the destination]
trans-unit.target: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway] - [Destination response is received] + [Message is routed to the destination]

trans-unit.source: Failures In Process
trans-unit.target: Failures In Process

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages that failed during processing by the BizTalk Service across all the bridges within a time interval.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages that failed during processing by the BizTalk Service across all the bridges within a time interval.

trans-unit.source: Messages Sent
trans-unit.target: Messages Sent

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages sent by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval. This metric is incremented when a message sent from a pipeline reaches the route destination. This metric does not indicate that a message is successfully processed.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages sent by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval. This metric is incremented when a message sent from a pipeline reaches the route destination. This metric does not indicate that a message is successfully processed.

trans-unit.source: In a Request-Reply scenario, the metric is incremented when the route destination sends a receipt acknowledgement back to the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: In a Request-Reply scenario, the metric is incremented when the route destination sends a receipt acknowledgement back to the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Messages Received
trans-unit.target: Messages Received

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages received by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval. This metric is incremented when a new message is received by the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages received by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval. This metric is incremented when a new message is received by the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Messages In Process
trans-unit.target: Messages In Process

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages currently being processed by the BizTalk Service within a time interval.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages currently being processed by the BizTalk Service within a time interval.

trans-unit.source: Messages Processed
trans-unit.target: Messages Processed

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages successfully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval. This metric is incremented when a message is successfully received by the pipeline and successfully routed to the destination.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages successfully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval. This metric is incremented when a message is successfully received by the pipeline and successfully routed to the destination.

trans-unit.source: In the Scale tab, you can add or subtract the number of units used by your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: In the Scale tab, you can add or subtract the number of units used by your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: By default, there is one Unit configured.
trans-unit.target: By default, there is one Unit configured.

trans-unit.source: Additional Units can be added to scale your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Additional Units can be added to scale your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: When you increase the scale, you are increasing throughput.
trans-unit.target: When you increase the scale, you are increasing throughput.

trans-unit.source: The amount of resources also increases, including deployed bridges, agreements, LOB connections, and processing power.
trans-unit.target: The amount of resources also increases, including deployed bridges, agreements, LOB connections, and processing power.

trans-unit.source: For example, you increase the scale from 1 Unit to 2 Units.
trans-unit.target: For example, you increase the scale from 1 Unit to 2 Units.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, you can deploy double the number of bridges, double the agreements, double the LOB connections, and double the processing power.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, you can deploy double the number of bridges, double the agreements, double the LOB connections, and double the processing power.

trans-unit.source: Some BizTalk editions do not offer a scale option.
trans-unit.target: Some BizTalk editions do not offer a scale option.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, one Unit is permitted.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, one Unit is permitted.

trans-unit.source: To determine how many units your edition can be scaled, refer to <linkText>BizTalk Services: Editions Chart</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To determine how many units your edition can be scaled, refer to <linkText>BizTalk Services: Editions Chart</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Increasing the number of units may impact pricing.
trans-unit.target: Increasing the number of units may impact pricing.

trans-unit.source: If you increase the Units, selecting Save displays a message that tells you if billing is impacted.
trans-unit.target: If you increase the Units, selecting Save displays a message that tells you if billing is impacted.

trans-unit.source: You then choose to continue.
trans-unit.target: You then choose to continue.

trans-unit.source: When you increase the number of Units, the BizTalk Service status changes from Active to Updating.
trans-unit.target: When you increase the number of Units, the BizTalk Service status changes from Active to Updating.

trans-unit.source: In the Updating state, your BizTalk Service continues to run.
trans-unit.target: In the Updating state, your BizTalk Service continues to run.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>BizTalk Services: Editions Chart</linkText><title></title> defines a "Unit".
trans-unit.target: <linkText>BizTalk Services: Editions Chart</linkText><title></title> defines a "Unit".

trans-unit.source: Does not apply to Hybrid Connections.
trans-unit.target: Does not apply to Hybrid Connections.

trans-unit.source: Sets the Backup Status to None or Automatic.
trans-unit.target: Sets the Backup Status to None or Automatic.

trans-unit.source: When set to None, no backups are automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When set to None, no backups are automatically created.

trans-unit.source: When set to Automatic, you configure the backup location, the frequency of the backup, and how long to keep the backup files.
trans-unit.target: When set to Automatic, you configure the backup location, the frequency of the backup, and how long to keep the backup files.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>BizTalk Services: Backup and Restore</linkText><title></title> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>BizTalk Services: Backup and Restore</linkText><title></title> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections connect an Azure application, like Websites or Mobile Services, to an on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, and most custom Web Services.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections connect an Azure application, like Websites or Mobile Services, to an on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, and most custom Web Services.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections are managed in BizTalk Services in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections are managed in BizTalk Services in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To create Hybrid Connections in Azure Websites, see <linkText>Hybrid Connection: Connect an Azure Web Site to an On-Premises Resource</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To create Hybrid Connections in Azure Websites, see <linkText>Hybrid Connection: Connect an Azure Web Site to an On-Premises Resource</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To use Hybrid Connections in Azure Mobile Services, see <linkText>Azure Mobile Services and Hybrid Connections</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To use Hybrid Connections in Azure Mobile Services, see <linkText>Azure Mobile Services and Hybrid Connections</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To create or manage Hybrid Connections in Azure BizTalk Services, see <linkText>Hybrid Connections</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To create or manage Hybrid Connections in Azure BizTalk Services, see <linkText>Hybrid Connections</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Now that you're familiar with the different tabs, you can learn more about the Azure BizTalk Services features:
trans-unit.target: Now that you're familiar with the different tabs, you can learn more about the Azure BizTalk Services features:
